intro: Swainsona ferrandi, commonly known as the yellow trumpet bush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet, with compound leaves and smooth, grayish bark. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for arid and semi-arid climates. Swainsona ferrandi is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
